<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:5px 15px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<h2 style="margin: 0px; line-height: 140%; text-align: center; word-wrap: break-word; font-family: trebuchet ms,geneva; font-size: 20px;">EAPL 2023 Conference</h2>
</td>

</table>
<table style="font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:5px 15px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<div style="line-height: 140%; text-align: left; word-wrap: break-word;">
<p style="line-height: 140%;">On behalf of the European Association of Psychology and Law (EAPL), it is our pleasure to invite you to the <strong>Annual Conference of the European Association of Psychology and Law (EAPL 2023)</strong>, with the topic <em>Legal Psychology: From Research to Effective Practices</em>. Besides the traditional format comprising a series of exceptional keynotes, workshops, open papers/symposia, and poster sessions, we aim to boost the interactivity and networking opportunities offered by the EAPL, while introducing new presentation types (blitz talks, expert focus sessions, and keynote outstanding questions).</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
<span style="text-decoration: underline; line-height: 19.6px;"><strong>Important dates</strong></span></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><strong>Submission deadline:</strong> <strong>April 24, 2023</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Notifications of acceptance will be offered on a rolling basis until <strong>May 15, 2023</strong>, at the latest.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
<span style="text-decoration: underline; line-height: 19.6px;"><strong>Main Themes</strong></span></p>
<ul>
<li style="line-height: 19.6px;">Eyewitness identification &amp; memory</li>
<li style="line-height: 19.6px;">Interviews, interrogations &amp; confessions</li>
<li style="line-height: 19.6px;">Deception detection &amp; malingering</li>
<li style="line-height: 19.6px;">Credibility assessment</li>
<li style="line-height: 19.6px;">Forensic &amp; risk assessment</li>
<li style="line-height: 19.6px;">Decision-making</li>
<li style="line-height: 19.6px;">Criminal investigations</li>
<li style="line-height: 19.6px;">Victims &amp; offenders</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><span style="text-decoration: underline; line-height: 19.6px;"><strong>Types of Submissions</strong></span></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><strong>Oral Presentation</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Oral presentation sessions provide the opportunity for an extended presentation of your research, followed by a discussion with participants within dedicated parallel sessions which will be grouped by the organizers.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><strong>Poster Presentation</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">The poster session will be a unique opportunity for an extended discussion of your research, potentially with all conference participants.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><strong>Blitz-Talk</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Blitz-Talks are concise individual contributions. Each presenter will have five minutes to present and two minutes for questions. Blitz-Talks can report all types of research, but this submission type is especially suitable for presenting single studies on novel topics, new data for discussion, replication studies, null findings, and multi-study papers using a well-known methodology.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><strong>Symposium</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">To encourage interaction between EAPL members on specific common topics of interest, we are welcoming oral symposia. A symposium chair (or two co-chairs) invites three to five colleagues, ideally belonging to different research groups to participate.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
For more details regarding submissions, <strong><a href="https://eaplconference.ro/index.php/call-for-papers" rel="nofollow">visit the website.</a></strong> You can follow us for more updates on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
Best regards,</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">The EAPL 2023 Organizing Team</p>
</div>
</td>

<h2 style="margin: 0px; line-height: 140%; text-align: center; word-wrap: break-word; font-family: trebuchet ms,geneva; font-size: 20px;">Call for Undergraduate Paper Award</h2>
</td>

<table style="font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:5px 15px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<div style="line-height: 140%; text-align: left; word-wrap: break-word;">
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><strong>Eligibility</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
To be eligible for an award, the student must be the major contributor to a project on a topic relevant to psychology and law (i.e., the student had primary responsibility for initiating and conducting the project even though the project will usually be conducted under the supervision of a mentor). Data collection should be complete. Winners will be encouraged to submit their work for presentation at the AP-LS Conference (as first authors). Students may submit their work during their first post-undergraduate year as long as the work was conducted during their undergraduate career.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
<strong>How to Apply</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
Submit one copy of APA-style paper (Abstract required). The paper should be a maximum of 25 pages of text (12-point font, one-inch margins), including the Abstract and Tables/Figures. The 25-page maximum does not include the Title Page and References. Papers that do not meet these requirements will be disqualified.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
Each applicant must have their mentor submit a letter of support to the chair that characterizes the nature and extent of the student’s contribution to the project. This letter should be a maximum of two pages of text (12-point font, one-inch margins). Applications that do not meet these requirements for letters of support will be disqualified.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
Deadline for receipt of all materials is <strong>June 30, 2023</strong>. The paper and mentor letter should be emailed to Dr. Emily Pica at <strong><a href="mailto:undergrad_paper@ap-ls.org" rel="nofollow">undergrad_paper@ap-ls.org</a></strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
Submissions from students whose mentors are serving on this committee are welcome, but those mentors will not review the papers.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
<strong><a href="https://ap-ls.org/awards/awards/undergradpaper.html" rel="nofollow">Please see website for additional details.</a></strong></p>
</div>
</td>

<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:5px 15px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<h2 style="margin: 0px; line-height: 140%; text-align: center; word-wrap: break-word; font-family: trebuchet ms,geneva; font-size: 20px;">APA Updates</h2>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table style="font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:5px 15px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<div style="line-height: 140%; text-align: left; word-wrap: break-word;">
<p style="line-height: 140%;">The APA Committee on Early Career Psychologists (CECP) seeks nominees for its Early Career Psychologist Achievement Awards. Awards are given to distinguished early career psychologists working in any area of psychology (e.g., education, practice, public interest, applied, and science) who have made a significant impact on psychology and/or society. Three awardees will be selected and receive $2,000 each. Applications are due <strong>April 24, 2023</strong>. For more information, <strong><a href="https://www.apa.org/about/awards/early-career-achievement?tab=1" rel="nofollow">visit our website</a></strong>.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
AP-LS is a member of the Divisions of Social Justice (DSJ). At the upcoming APA Convention in August 2023, DSJ will lead several presentations focused on reproductive justice. The AP-LS representative to DSJ is Dr. Cassandra Bailey, who also serves as DSJ Secretary.&nbsp;</p>
</div>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="padding: 0px;background-color: transparent">
<div style="Margin: 0 auto;min-width: 320px;max-width: 600px;overflow-wrap: break-word;word-wrap: break-word;word-break: break-word;background-color: #ffffff;">
<div style="border-collapse: collapse;display: table;width: 100%;height: 100%;background-color: transparent;">

<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:10px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<table height="0px" align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse: collapse;table-layout: fixed;border-spacing: 0;mso-table-lspace: 0pt;mso-table-rspace: 0pt;vertical-align: top;border-top: 1px solid #BBBBBB;-ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%">
<tbody>
<tr style="vertical-align: top">

<table style="font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:5px 15px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<h2 style="margin: 0px; line-height: 140%; text-align: center; word-wrap: break-word; font-family: trebuchet ms,geneva; font-size: 20px;">APA Science Partners Program</h2>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table style="font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:5px 15px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<div style="line-height: 140%; text-align: left; word-wrap: break-word;">
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Last year, as part of their efforts to elevate attention and focus on psychological science within the American Psychological Association, the APA started a new Science Partners program with liaisons with each of the divisions to share information to and from the divisions with the broader APA community.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
Please <strong><a href="https://apls.memberclicks.net/assets/Email_Files/Emails_Newsletter/2023/APA%20Science%20Everywhere.pdf" rel="nofollow">download</a></strong> a short document that APA put together to share a summary of its science-focused efforts, with highlights of what we can do as a division and as individual scientists to connect with APA's broader efforts.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
There are already several efforts underway involving AP-LS (such as the amicus briefs program; journal participation in ongoing initiatives such as open science, editorial fellow program, and the editor's choice newsletter; cross-cutting initiatives at APA convention involving AP-LS with other divisions).</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">There may be more we are doing - and we can bring that information back to APA to explain the efforts we're engaged in that are relevant to highlighting APA's science focus - <a href="mailto:office@ap-ls.org" rel="nofollow">please let us know</a> if there are other things that our division might want to feature for APA. And bring your ideas to the EC if you have thoughts about how our division can further represent what we are doing to APA and/or engage in new opportunities with other divisions.</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<h2 style="margin: 0px; line-height: 140%; text-align: center; word-wrap: break-word; font-family: trebuchet ms,geneva; font-size: 20px;">The AP-LS Teaching, Training, and Careers (TTC) Committee Recognizes Dr. Angela Evans and Dr. Ashley Batastini Through the Outstanding Teaching and Mentoring in the Field of Psychology and Law Awards</h2>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>

<table style="font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" border="0">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:5px 15px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<div style="line-height: 140%; text-align: left; word-wrap: break-word;">
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Each year, AP-LS and the TTC Committee recognize excellence in teaching and mentorship in the field demonstrated by two of our members. This year, these awards are specific to members who have taught and mentored trainees at the doctoral and post-doctoral level. Please join us in congratulating the following members for their outstanding work and contributions to teaching and mentoring in the field of psychology and law:</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
<strong>2023 Outstanding Teaching and Mentoring Award</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Angela Evans, PhD</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Professor and Associate Chair of Psychology</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Brock University, Ontario, Canada</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
<strong>2023 Early Career Teaching and Mentoring Award</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Ashley Batastini, PhD</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Assistant Professor of Counseling Psychology&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">University of Memphis, Memphis, TN</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
<strong><a href="https://apls.memberclicks.net/assets/Email_Files/Emails_Newsletter/2023/Clincial%20Forensic%20Practice%20Award%20Announcement.pdf" rel="nofollow">Read more</a></strong> about the 2023 winners and next year’s awards.</p>
</div>
</td>

<div style="line-height: 140%; text-align: left; word-wrap: break-word;">
<p style="line-height: 140%;">The Career Corner is intended to highlight the individuals who work at the intersection of law and psychology, where they come from, how they got there, and how their experiences influence their research, teaching, and/or practice. This edition of Career Corner profiles Elizabeth Hey, a federal magistrate judge in the Eastern District of Pennsylvania. Judge Hey presides over a federal mental health court while also presiding over pre-trial matters for the district.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><br>
<strong><a href="https://apls.memberclicks.net/assets/Email_Files/Emails_Newsletter/2023/CareerCorner_Judge%20Hey%20April%202023.pdf" rel="nofollow">Read this column.</a></strong></p>

<td style="overflow-wrap:break-word;word-break:break-word;padding:5px 15px;font-family:trebuchet ms,geneva;" align="left">
<div style="line-height: 140%; text-align: left; word-wrap: break-word;">
<p style="line-height: 140%;">The American Psychology-Law Society invites proposals for new titles in its book series, which is now published by <strong><a href="https://www.apa.org/pubs/books" rel="nofollow">APA Books</a></strong>. We publish authored and edited volumes on current issues at the intersection of psychology and law. Books are typically a state of the science synthesis of a body of existing research with implications for practice and/or policy. Authors and editors should have a substantial and recent track record of publication and/or practice in psychology or law, and at least one should hold a doctorate in psychology or closely related behavioral science. If you have a proposal for a new book in the series or you would simply like more information, reach out to a member of the editorial team. We would be happy to tell you more. &nbsp; &nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;"><strong>The editorial board members are:</strong></p>
<p style="line-height: 140%;">Monica Miller, Division 41 Book Series Editor (<a href="mkmiller@unr.edu" rel="nofollow">mkmiller@unr.edu</a>)<br>
Monique Bowen, Division 41 Book Series Associate Editor (<a href="mbowen2@antioch.edu" rel="nofollow">mbowen2@antioch.edu</a>)<br>
Jemour Maddux, Division 41 Book Series Associate Editor (<a href="jm@rule702.com" rel="nofollow">jm@rule702.com</a>)&nbsp;</p>
</div>
